meanings.definition: Convert or attempt to convert (someone) from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She proselytised her friend to join her church.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries proselytised the villagers to follow their faith.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic preacher proselytised the squirrels to believe in acorns.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team proselytised the customers to switch to their brand.
meanings.sent5: He proselytised with such passion that even the rocks seemed to listen.

meanings.definition: Advocate or promote (a belief or course of action).
meanings.sent1: She proselytised for environmental conservation in her community.
meanings.sent2: The politician proselytised for better healthcare policies.
meanings.sent3: The cat proselytised for more treats by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: The teacher proselytised the benefits of reading to her students.
meanings.sent5: He proselytised the importance of kindness with every action he took.
